intro: Allocarya divaricata, commonly known as the variable rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in racemes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Allocarya divaricata is characterized by its branched stems and alternate leaves, which are often hairy and robust.
